info:
# Rule Documentation

Rules store the instructions for the Automation Engines which incoming sensor readings to check and what what to do.
Rules are stored as object in an array.

Below example shows my washing machine cycle, where a high energy consumption sets the washing machine state to "washing". If during the washing state the consumption drops below 2, it sets the status back to idle and issues a command which can trigger an email or notification that the washing has been completed.
To archieve this 2 rules are needed, the first rule looks for the increase in power consumption to determine if a washing is in progress. The second rule looks for the low consumption to triggere the "washing completed" message.

## Rule Header

```
    {
        "name": "Washing Starts",
        "enabled": true,
        "operator": "AND",
```
Above is the header of the rule, which contains a name that will be included in the message logs.
`enabled` attributes controls if the rule is executed or not.
The `operator` describes if all the conditions need to be met (AND) or only one of the condition needs to be met (OR).

## Rule Conditions

```
        "conditions": [
```
`conditions` attribute is an array which lists all the conditions (triggers) for the rule. Each condition has a `trigger` attribute which describes if the condition is triggered by update on data value, or for example time.

### Data and State triggers

This section explains how to create a trigger on a data value or state value. This condition should be used when the condition is to be compared with a data point or state. When data update for (in the below case) `washingmachine_power` arrived to the node, the logic know which rules to check - which has a condition for this data point.
These conditions always contain either a `"trigger": "data"` or `"trigger": "state"` attribute.

```
            {
                "trigger": "data",
                "operand": "washingmachine_power",
                "operator": "GT",
                "value": 270
            },
```
Each condition has an `operand` which is a data point id that is sent to the node, or a state id which is set by one of the rule.
`operator` is the condition operator, and current EQ=equal, GT=greather than and LT=less than supported.
`value` is the value to check against. 
In the above example the condition is true if the value of the `washingmachine_power` is more than 270.

```
            {
                "trigger": "state",
                "operand": "washingmachine_state",
                "operator": "EQ",
                "value": "IDLE"
            }
        ],
```
This is same as above, but in this case the `operand` is a state (which will be defined below), and the value is a string not a number.

### Time Conditions

These conditions should be used if the rule needs to be evaluated as a certain time of the day. For example I want to receive my "plants are dry" validation in the evening when I have time to water them. Of course, the time condition can be used in conjunction with other data conditions, but this ensures it is only validated at a specific time.
Time conditions defines hour and minute of the day when the rule is evaluated.

```
            {
                "trigger": "time",
                "operand": "",
                "operator": "EQ",
                "value": "19:00"
            },
```

The `trigger` value in this case is `time`, `operand` is not required, `operator` is `EQ` (others can also be used, but may not be properly evaluated), and the `value` is the time in HH:MM format (24 hour format).
For performance reasons we suggest to put the time condition as the first condition in the `conditions` list, so the code does not check the rest of the conditions if the time does not match with the current time.

## Rule Actions

```
        "actions": [
```
`actions` is an array which contains action that are executed if the conditions are met.

Few examples of supported actions:

### Setting state

This example is used to set internal state that can be used in rule conditions. As in the above example power > 270 is evaluated with the state of IDLE. And power < 2 is only considered if the state is WASHING.

```
            {
                "type": "setstate",
                "state": "washingmachine_state",
                "name": "Washingmachine State",
                "value": "WASHING"
            }
```
`type` is set to `setstate`, `state` and `name` are the id and name of the state. Id can be used on conditions, name is only for logging.
`value` is the new state value to be set. This can be a number or text. State gets stored in the flow variable `datacache` along with other values. For this reason the state id and data id should be unique.

IMPORTANT: if the state does not exists yet (because let's say Node-Red just restarted), the condition will evaluate to true. This explicitly assumes that this is the initial state. Since the rules are executed in order, make sure the rule with the "assumed initial state" is in the list first.

### Sending Commands

This action sends a message out of the output port of the Automation Engine function node which can be used to control devices, send messages, etc.

```
            {
                "type": "control",
                "topic": "washing_complete",
                "value": 1
            }
```
`type` is set to `control`, `topic` is a text and will be used as `msg.topic` of the outgoing message. `value` can be a number or text and will be used as `msg.payload` of the outgoing message.

```
        ]
    },
```
Finally close the actions array and the rule object.

name: Version History
info:
# Version 1.3 - Rule editor

- Rule editor screen
- Show rules, select rules, select conditions, select actions
- Edit existing conditions
- Enable/Disable rules (buttons)

# Version 1.2 - Small changes

- Log level added to settings
- Context storage can be defined in settings
- Enable/disable flag for rules

# Version 1.1 - Time conditions

- Condition checking exists after a false condition - peformance improvment
- Adding trigger attribute to conditions (date|state|time)
- Time condition is available

# Version 1.0 - First Release

- Core logic
- Supported conditions: data value, state
- Supported operators: LT, EQ, GT
- Supported actions: setstate, control
- State logging for debugging
- Simple UI to monitor data

name: Settings Documentation
info:
## Rule Storage Context

Defines the store for the rules. Default value is "" which is the default storage context, but change it to any of the context defined in the settings.js.

## Log Level

Set the logging level of the logic. Higher value means more messages are shown, lower value less messages.
- 0: Critical messages
- 1: Error messages
- 2: Warning messages
- 3: Information messages
- 4: Debug messages

E.g. if `loglevel` is set to 3, the system will show messages in priority 0-3.

format:
<template>
  <v-card class="mx-auto" color="white" width="100%">
    <v-img class="text-white" height="62" src="https://cdn.vuetifyjs.com/images/backgrounds/vbanner.jpg"
      cover>

      <v-toolbar color="transparent">
        <v-toolbar-title class="text-h6" text="Rule List"></v-toolbar-title>
                <v-tooltip text="Refresh rule list" location="top">
                  <template v-slot:activator="{ props }" v-slot:append>
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-refresh" @click="send({topic: 'refresh', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                  </template>
                </v-tooltip>
                <v-tooltip text="Enabled rule" location="top">
                  <template v-slot:activator="{ props }" v-slot:append>
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-bell-check" @click="send({topic: 'enablerule', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                  </template>
                </v-tooltip>
                <v-tooltip text="Disable rule" location="top">
                  <template v-slot:activator="{ props }" v-slot:append>
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-bell-cancel" @click="send({topic: 'disablerule', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                  </template>
                </v-tooltip>
                <v-tooltip text="Move Up" location="top">
                  <template v-slot:activator="{ props }" v-slot:append>
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-arrow-up-bold-circle-outline" @click="send({topic: 'moveup', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                  </template>
                </v-tooltip>
                <v-tooltip text="Move Down" location="top">
                  <template v-slot:activator="{ props }" v-slot:append>
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-arrow-down-bold-circle-outline" @click="send({topic: 'movedown', payload: null})">
                    </v-btn>
                  </template>
                </v-tooltip>
      </v-toolbar>
      </v-img>







    <v-card-text>
      <v-list bg-color="white">
      
        <v-list-item v-for="(item, index) in items" :key="index" :value="index" :title="item.name" :subtitle="item.subtitle"
          :prepend-icon="getEnabledIcon(item)" @click="send({topic: 'selected', payload: item})">
        </v-list-item>
      </v-list>
    </v-card-text>

  </v-card>
</template>




<script>
  export default {
        data() {
            return {
                counter: 0,
                items: [],
                selected: []
            }
        },
        mounted() {
            this.counter = 0
        },
        watch: {
            msg: function(){            
                if(this.msg.payload != undefined) {                    
                    this.items = this.msg.payload;
                    this.selected = [];
                    this.counter = this.items.length;     
                    this.send({payload:undefined});
                }
            }
        },
        methods: {
          getEnabledIcon: function (item) {
            if (item !== undefined ) {
              if (item.enabled) {
                return 'mdi-bell-check'
                  } else {
                return 'mdi-bell-cancel'
              }
            }
          }
        }
    }
</script>

<style>
  .v-overlay__content .v-list {
    background: rgba(var(--v-group-background));
    color: rgba(var(--v-group-on-background), var(--v-high-emphasis-opacity));
  }
</style>

<template>


<v-card class="mx-auto" color="white" width="100%">
    <v-img class="text-white" height="62" src="https://cdn.vuetifyjs.com/images/backgrounds/vbanner.jpg" cover>

    <v-card-subtitle>
        {{ subtitle }}
    </v-card-subtitle>

    </v-card>
    <v-card class="mx-auto" color="white" width="100%">
        
        <v-toolbar color="transparent">
            <v-toolbar-title class="text-h6" text="Conditions"></v-toolbar-title>
            <v-tooltip text="Move condition up" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-boom-gate-arrow-up-outline"
                        @click="send({topic: 'conditionup', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Move condition down" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-boom-gate-arrow-down-outline"
                        @click="send({topic: 'conditiondown', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Add condition" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-file-document-plus-outline"
                        @click="send({topic: 'addcondition', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Delete condition" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-delete"
                        @click="send({topic: 'deletecondition', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
    
        </v-toolbar>
        <v-card-text>
            <v-list bg-color="white">
                <v-list-item v-for="(item, index) in conditions" :key="index" :value="index" :title="item.text"
                    :prepend-icon="getConditionIcon(item)" @click="send({topic: 'condition', payload: item})">
                </v-list-item>
            </v-list>
        </v-card-text>
    </v-card>
    <v-card class="mx-auto" color="white" width="100%">
        
        <v-toolbar color="transparent">
            <v-toolbar-title class="text-h6" text="Actions"></v-toolbar-title>
            <v-tooltip text="Move action up" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-gesture-swipe-up" @click="send({topic: 'actionup', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Move action down" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-gesture-swipe-down" @click="send({topic: 'actiondown', payload: null})">
                    </v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Add SetState Action" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-book-plus-multiple" @click="send({topic: 'addsetstateaction', payload: null})">
                    </v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Add Control Action" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-sign-direction-plus" @click="send({topic: 'addcontrolaction', payload: null})">
                    </v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
            <v-tooltip text="Delete action" location="top">
                <template v-slot:activator="{ props }">
                    <v-btn v-bind="props" icon="mdi-delete" @click="send({topic: 'deleteaction', payload: null})"></v-btn>
                </template>
            </v-tooltip>
        </v-toolbar>
        <v-card-text>
            <v-list bg-color="white">
                <v-list-item v-for="(item, index) in actions" :key="index" :value="index" :title="item.text"
                    :prepend-icon="getActionIcon(item)" @click="send({topic: 'action', payload: item})">
                </v-list-item>
            </v-list>
        </v-card-text>
    
    </v-card>
</template>

<script>
    export default {
        data() {
            // define variables available component-wide
            // (in <template> and component functions)
            return {
                rulename: "",
                subtitle: "",
                conditions: [],
                actions: []
            }
        },
        watch: {
            // watch for any changes of "count"
            msg: function() {
                if(this.msg.payload != undefined){
                    this.rulename = this.msg.payload.name;
                    this.subtitle = this.msg.payload.subtitle;
                    this.conditions = this.msg.payload.conditions;
                    this.actions = this.msg.payload.actions;
                    this.send({payload:undefined});
                }
            }
        },
        computed: {
        },
        methods: {
            getConditionIcon: function (item) {
                if (item !== undefined ) {
                    switch(item.trigger) {
                        case "time":
                            return "mdi-clock-time-eight-outline";
                            break;
                        case "data":
                            return "mdi-matrix";
                            break;
                        case "state":
                            return "mdi-state-machine";
                            break;
                    }
                }
            },
            getActionIcon: function (item) {
                if (item !== undefined ) {
                    switch(item.type) {
                        case "control":
                            return "mdi-message-processing";
                            break;
                        case "setstate":
                            return "mdi-bullhorn";
                            break;
                    }
                }
            }
        },
        mounted() {
        },
        unmounted() {
        }
    }
</script>
